pr_title: SONARJAVA-2154 Remove usages of guava annotations from java-frontend module

timeline.message: Remove usages of com.google.common.base package from java-frontend module
SONARJAVA-2154 Remove usages of guava base package from java-frontend module
SONARJAVA-2154 Remove usages of guava base package from java-frontend module

timeline.bodyText:
If I understand correctly, this code is inspired by the one from Guava, and is used to detect loops at the same time. Still, I believe it could use a few comments explaining the idea behind it.
In addition, we should cover this code somehow.
timeline.author: quentin-jaquier-sonarsource

replies.bodyText: Yes, the code is actually the same as in guava. It uses the standard algorithm to find a loop, which is having 2 pointers. one normal and other 2x times slower, increments on each second iteration. And if at some point 2 pointers are equal it means that we have a cycle here.
replies.author: margarita-nedzelska-sonarsource
